meanings.definition: Of or relating to a class or group of things
meanings.sent1: The generical classification helped organize the items neatly.
meanings.sent2: The generical characteristics of the animals made them easy to identify.
meanings.sent3: It was a generical mix-up when the toys got all jumbled together.
meanings.sent4: Her generical approach to problem-solving was like fitting puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent5: The generical concept of shapes made learning geometry fun.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of a particular kind or class
meanings.sent1: The generical features of the car made it stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent2: His generical style of painting was admired by many.
meanings.sent3: It was a generical coincidence that they both wore the same shirt.
meanings.sent4: The generical beauty of the sunset took her breath away.
meanings.sent5: The generical aroma of fresh bread filled the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: She gave a generical response to the question, not wanting to reveal too much.
meanings.sent2: The generical packaging made it hard to distinguish one brand from another.
meanings.sent3: It was a generical mistake to assume all birds could fly.
meanings.sent4: His generical advice to 'be happy' was not very helpful.
meanings.sent5: The generical feeling of nostalgia washed over her as she looked at old photos.
